case_vignette: a 8-year-old male with no significant past medical history presents to the emergency room with fever, headache, malaise and rhinorrhea ongoing for past two days with recent known tick exposure. parents deny any recent medication exposures. he is admitted to the hospital and over the next few days, he develops a rash beginning on the ankles and wrists that progressively spread onto the trunk. physical examination reveals blanching erythematous macules on ankles, wrists, and trunk with few scattered petechiae and purpura on the bilateral ankles. he is mildly febrile and labs do not demonstrate any leukocytosis.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having a fever, headache, feeling generally unwell, and a runny nose for the past two days.
Have you noticed any changes or new developments on your skin?
Yes, I developed a rash that started on my ankles and wrists and has spread to my trunk.
Is the rash itchy or painful?
The description doesn't specify if the rash is itchy or painful, so I cannot answer that.
Have you been in contact with anyone who was sick or had similar symptoms recently?
No, I haven't been in contact with anyone sick, but I was recently exposed to a tick.
Do you have any known allergies or chronic medical conditions?
No, I don't have any known allergies or chronic medical conditions.
Final Diagnosis: Rocky Mountain Spotted Fever
